content: I'd also like to improve the async vision doc by listing out various interesting "extreme cases" -- basically use cases we want to ensure that we support. Hopefully these are things we support today but we don't want to "lose" that support (in some cases, there may be issues -- e.g., #66481 works against "single-threaded executor", which is an argument for fixing it. These use cases are often in tension with ergonomics.

On that note: in single-threaded code generally, atomics are unnecessary. Should superfluous/unavoidable atomics/memory fences be considered a violation of zero-cost abstractions going forward? (Even if the ship has sailed w.r.t Waker)
Debatable. I think there's a tension there about simplicity.
